actions.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

official_title: A resolution to state the sense of the Senate that the government of the United States should place priority on formulating a comprehensive and strategic policy of engaging and cooperating with Japan in advancing science and technology for the benefit of both nations as well as the rest of the world.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Senate that: (1) the U.S. Government should place priority on formulating a comprehensive and strategic policy of engaging and cooperating with Japan in advancing science and technology for the benefit of both nations as well as the rest of the world; (2) that policy should aim to promote strategic cooperation on areas that further U.S. policy interests in science and technology, more balanced flows of scientific and technological information and personnel between the United States and Japan, more rigorous application of scientific methods in the development of standards and regulations to promote efficient technological progress and mitigate trade problems, and more equitable intellectual property protection; and (3) the U.S. Government should integrate this strategic policy into current and future science and technology agreements with the Government of Japan.

titles.title: A resolution to state the sense of the Senate that the government of the United States should place priority on formulating a comprehensive and strategic policy of engaging and cooperating with Japan in advancing science and technology for the benefit of both nations as well as the rest of the world.
